name: Interesting People, Places, and Words Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: 'Chateaubriand' is a fine dish for dinner. Who was Chateaubriand?
'King Philip's War' was a conflict which involved the American colonists. Who was King Philip?
questions.explanation:
Indian Leader.

	Son of Masasoit. Indian trouble (Prior to the French and Indian war).

questions.text: Certain people are referred to as 'bohemians'. Where is Bohemia?
'Beef Stroganoff' is another fine dish for dinner. For whom was it named?
questions.explanation:
Diplomat.

	A Russian diplomat named Stroganov. (Use your imagination for Napoleons, Napoleon Brandy and Beef Wellington.)

questions.text: 'Bonnie Prince Charlie' claimed a connection to the English throne through what royal family?
questions.explanation:
Stuart.

	He was referred to as a 'pretender'. Everyone has heard of him - but no one knows why.

questions.text: Captain Cook, one of the world's great explorers, sailed just about everywhere. When did he make his trips?
Everyone has heard of Lucrezia Borgia (and her family, too). What is she famous for?
questions.explanation:
Political Intrigue.

	Some people believe that Lucrezia was more sinned against than sinning; they claim that because she settled to a very quiet family life once the disrupting influence of her father and brother was removed she was another of their victims, not a protagonist.

questions.text: Everyone has heard of 'The Count of Monte Cristo'. Where is Monte Cristo located?
questions.explanation:
Off the coast of Italy.

	Yes, it's a real place

questions.text: A famous play asks the question: 'Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?'. To what does the title refer?
questions.explanation:
Suicide and Insanity.

	She had periods of insanity which ended only with her (self-inflicted) death. Sad.

questions.text: With whom did the term 'sandwich' originate?
questions.explanation:
Englishman.

	He was the Earl of Sandwich, I believe.
